original_title: SLPP wants to remove PUCSL Chief, SJB says NO
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna has decided to vote in favor of the proposal presented to parliament to remove Janaka Ratnayake from serving as a member of the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka.
SLPP General Secretary Attorney Sagara Kariyawasam said that SLPP does not condone in any way the conduct of the Chairman of the PUCSL.
Therefore, the SLPP had decided to support the motion to remove Janaka Ratnayake from the post.
The Samagi Jana Balavegaya said that it would oppose the motion presented to the parliament to remove Janaka Ratnayake from serving as a member of the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka.
SJB General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara said that the main opposition group would stand up for Ratnayake, as he stood against the attempts to increase the electricity tariff.

The proposal presented to the parliament to remove Janaka Ratnayake from serving as a member of the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka is to be taken up for debate on the 24th of May, and a vote will also take place on the same day.
